meanings.definition: Daks (noun): a colloquial term for trousers or pants.
meanings.sent1: I need to buy new daks for school.
meanings.sent2: She folded her daks neatly in the drawer.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to climb into the daks hanging on the clothesline.
meanings.sent4: The colorful daks brightened up his outfit.
meanings.sent5: His favorite pair of daks had a small rip at the knee.

meanings.definition: Daks (verb): to pull down someone's trousers as a prank.
meanings.sent1: During the school play, they tried to daks the lead actor.
meanings.sent2: He got daksed in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy loved to daks his friends during recess.
meanings.sent4: She felt embarrassed when her brother daksed her in front of her crush.
meanings.sent5: The prankster always found a way to daks someone at the party.
